item.title: Report E-2023100891
item.description:
Report E-2023100891

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product UN 1819 Sodium Aluminate Solution released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a crack in the top of the tote (unknown). The product was transferred from the damaged tote into two new 275-gallon poly totes for shipment on. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (5) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023100330
item.description:
Report X-2023100330

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Admin discovered a wet fiberboard box without diamond label, UN number, or proper shipping name on HMPA staging pallet in a tote. DescribePack: One of three 7.3oz metal aerosol cans depressurized and lost all fluid due to inadequate preparation for transport; no internal partitions or covers for the aerosol valve mechanism found. Unsecured valve stems freely released gas and fluid when box put under the (not excessive) weight of other packages. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, all spillage absorbed, and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2023100267
item.description:
Report X-2023100267

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-23
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Fully regulated hazmat in wet fiberboard box discovered on loadside and relabeled by ops admin. All spillage and packaging contained in a lined tote and transported to HMPA for reporting. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.6 gallon of fluid due to a loose cap closure. Threads may be worn; spillage cannot be stoppered when bottle is tilted to side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used. Tote used to transport material to HMPA was lined with hazbag.

Report X-2023100256

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking and wet at the bottom. Crack was found at the bottom. Bottle being placed on the side keeps leaking from continuing. DescribePack: Crack. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bottle was placed in a hazmat bag and keep on its side so crack is facing upwards.

item.title: Report X-2023090794
item.description:
Report X-2023090794

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was presented to a Memphis spill agent. The box contained 4 small paint cans, fiberboard dividers, and Styrofoam peanuts for dunnage. Each can was individually enclosed in a single clear plastic bag. Each bag was sealed via bag tie. Each can had ring locks for positive closure. 1 of the 4 cans was dented inward on one side allowing the loss of contents from the top lid. Contact Shipper for disposition. An amended Shipper's Declaration is needed for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023090754
item.description:
Report X-2023090754

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-17
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found with signs of release at the Memphis Hub. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans with positive closure rings and fiberboard dividers. One of the cans had a damaged bottom chime causing a release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and returned to the shipper after receiving an amended shippers declaration .

item.title: Report X-2023090483
item.description:
Report X-2023090483

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-09
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 9/9/2023 at approximately 00:14, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 281407 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of one metal can inside of a fiberboard box. The metal can appeared to have a loose top and the plastic bottle inside of the metal can was discovered having a loose cap, resutling in spillage. The entire contents leaked from the pacakge, leaving nothing salvageable. The container was disposed of as hazardous waste.

item.description:
Report X-2023090474

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Sept 6th during the PM sort a plastic jerrican was found leaking. It contained UN1197 Extracts, liquid mixture, 3, PGIII and there were two small punctures found on the bottom, however the cause of those punctures is unknown. The jerrican was placed into a salvage drum and the consignee was contacted to provide an amended shippers declaration.

item.title: Report X-2023090198
item.description:
Report X-2023090198

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-04T06:23:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-09
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 9/9/2023 at approximately 1430, Dangerous Good Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a spill incident, involving an undeclared corrosive liquid. The shipment consists of 1 fiberboard box conaining six 64oz bottles of Clobber drain cleaner. Per an online safety data safety, the shipment contained concentrated sulfuric acid and is classifed as UN 1830. Three of the bottles spilled from the package resulting in sizable spill and contaminating an estimated 30 packages. A vendor was called in the contain the spill. The affected shipments have been handles accrodingly. Further investigation revealed the spilled package was not declared as dangerous goods, in compliance with IATA Regulations. The shipment is places in a salvage drum and is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2023081761
item.description:
Report X-2023081761

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was dispatched to the dangerous goods building for a fiberboard box with signs of release. The fiberboard box contained three metal cans of various sizes two contained UN1263 and the third had UN1993. The one containing the UN1993 had a loose cap and caused a release inside of the fiberboard box. All were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023081418
item.description:
Report X-2023081418

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to an outbound sort operations for a class 9 in a fiberboard box with signs of a release. The spill agent was told that the fiberboard box had been dropped while it was being unloaded from a cart. While investigating the fiberboard box there was a single steel drum inside. The top chime of the steel drum had been damaged and was the source of the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be needed for movement.
